definition: to give the green light/to give the go-ahead

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Copenhagen will provide the green light for green growth.
sentences.chinese: 哥本哈根將爲綠色增長大開綠燈。

sentences.english: He said that the release of the men gave the green light to terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 他說，釋放這些人，等於向恐怖主義活動開綠燈。
